attributes.comment:
I, Tamara L. Wilkins, am an adoptive parent to a daughter from China. When I was
completeing paperwork a few years ago, it cost approximately $700 in fees to the
USCIS for the I600-A and the fingerprints. With the proposed rate changes along
with the "expiration" dates of the I600-A and fingerprints (which I don't
understand...how can fingerprints "expire?"), it would cost more than $1600 for the
SAME services! I do not think this is fair to adoptive parents, who are already
beset with fees from their adoption agency, the country of origin of their child and
others. I fear that it could discourage potential parents from adopting, and lead to
more children without homes.

The other increase I oppose is the increase in fees for the Certificate of
Citizenship for children who arrived in-country on an IR-4 visa. Those children are
legally citizens, and I feel their parents should not have to pay to prove it, much
less pay almost $500.

Please reconsider these increases and think about what is in the best interests of
the children and families.

Sincerely,
Ms. Lee Wilkins
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Tamara Wilkins
